name: Hotel Nikko Saigon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Can't fault this hotel. Was at the end of a long tour through Asia, so we needed to relax. The staff are excellent and so helpful. Breakfast buffet is amazing. The executive lounge on the 23rd floor is great too. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this hotel! It was like an oasis in the midst of all the hustle of HCMC. At the rates we got, it was truly value-for-money!
reviews.title: Excellent Services, Facilities & Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms & Amenities: Huge room, lovely bathtub (with complimentary bath salts to go for a soak in) and separate toilet.
reviews.title: Awesome! Sleek and tops on service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Services: Friendly, polite & efficient! Check-in was quick. Even though we were earlier than the normal check-in time, they were able to give us a room 2 hours earlier. The concierge was very friendly and informative, giving us tips on massage and food. Language wasn't a problem as all staff could speak English (which says volumes as most locals including taxi drivers couldn't understand simple English.)
reviews.title: Club room is a must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: I think this would be the only draw-back. It is not as near to Ben Tanh market or other sight-seeing locations as other hotels. However, the hotel provides a FOC shuttle service which was useful. And taxis were of course cheap and plenty, so it didn't pose too much of a problem for us. It was located beside a mall which has a food court.
reviews.title: Excellent attention to detail - Japanese quality at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in nikko saigon for 2 nights before mui ne and after for 2 more nights.both times were excellent.
reviews.title: great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: the hotel is looking brand new.decoration is modern, minimal and elegant.
reviews.title: A Cut Above...and below

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our room was a premium deluxe very comfortable modern in style and very relaxing.first time i saw a japanese style toilet-very trendy!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: our room had everything you needed for a perfect stay-mini bar, t.v. with a large variety of asian and international channels,complimentary tea-coffee facilities, complimentary bottle of water etc, etc.
reviews.title: Great stay, lovely rooms. Just what we needed:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This 5* hotel provides excellent service with a reasonable price. From the bellman to the receptionist, the waiter/waitress and housekeeping, their service is splendid! Rooms were comfortable with all the amenities that you require. Big shower room and a well-maintained bath tub, and most important the cleanliness. We enjoyed the breakfast very much. The spread is fantastic with the menu from the east to the west. Although the hotel location is quite off from the main city but getting taxi is not a problem. I have no regrets booking in to this hotel. My thumbs up to them for their excellent service.
reviews.title: Reasonable price with Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Not in core district 1 which is one of the drawbacks, good 15 mins drive through the chaos of the city to reach the happening area. If we knew it was not in core district 1 we would have not have stayed here as its hassling taking a taxi up and down. The hotel address says district 1 but its more towards district 5 rather than 1.
reviews.title: Poor location but good property with potential to improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Buffet Breakfast: Good spread with Japanese, Western and Oriental options. We particularly liked the eggs section which included options like Spanish Omelette and Eggs Benedict which we though was pretty rare and impressive. Being a Japanese branded hotel, we expected a wider range of sushi than what was offered, a tray of single type of sushi nestled in the corner of the buffer display. The Vietnamese section could also have been given a bit more importance rather than the noodle soup section which appeared to be on the line of "Pho" but was nowhere close and the insipid looking Banh Mi. In terms of coffee which is Vietnam's staple drink, the probably could look to serve traditional Vietnamese coffee and maybe like to invest in a decent coffee machine to churn out morning espressos and cappuccinos rather than unimpressive self service coffee vending machine.
reviews.title: Brilliant in every aspect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Common Areas: Particularly liked the interiors of the lobby areas and the color and design maintained throughout the hotel. The swimming is just about average, the hotel should look to redo the pool area. Maybe some landscaping and making the general ambiance much more relaxing and resort like.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Rooms: For us, the bathroom was the highlight equipped with a massive tub, separate shower cubicle and a separate enclosure for the WC. The rooms was particularly spacious and the view was amazing. We were staying in a club deluxe premium rooms on the 22nd floor.
reviews.title: Absolute perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I started and finished our Vietnam holiday at Hotel Nikko. We hadn't booked accommodation for the end of our Saigon stay, but after staying at Hotel Nikko on our first couple of nights, had no hesitation in booking the accommodaton for the retun leg of our trip.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is immaculate as are the rooms. Big comfy beds, and extremely cean rooms. The service from staff is first class - Everyone takes pride in their work and the breakfast is amazing. So much choice - western, Japanese and vietnamese dishes.
reviews.title: 5 Star hotel at bargain price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: When I return to Saigon, I will not bother to check other hotels as Hotel Nikko ticks all my boxes. Excellent rooms, staff, gym, pool, breakfast.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel designed with meticulous mind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great spotlessly clean hotel with modern minimalist design. Staff very helpful and friendly. Five star hotel at a 3 star price. Clean modern Gym and basic pool area. Breakfast is great and the club lounge with benefits is worth paying the extra money for. There is a free shuttle to the major sights which is very convenient.
reviews.title: More than excellent

description: Hotel Nikko Saigon is a 5 star luxury hotel with 388 rooms, suites and apartments. The guestrooms are spaciously appointed and specifically designed to enable guests to both concentrated work and undisturbed relaxation in the comfort of their own room - an oasis of calm in this busy city. Spa with treatment rooms. Outdoor swimming pool, modern gymnasium, Japanese restaurant, Chinese restaurant, Lobby lounge, International Buffet restaurant with all day dining and 24 hours room service. Nikko Club Lounge is located on 23rd floor, the highest level lounge where you can enjoy the spectacular view of the city. Complimentary shuttle service to and from Ho Chi Minh City center is provided.
